item.title: Neural Networks for Insurance Pricing
item.description: In this notebook we will be looking at a typicall insurance pricing data set and test GLM and NN models. A typical assumption is that the repsone is poisson: $$ P(Y = y) = \frac{\lambda^y \exp(-\lambda)}{y!}$$ To note a shortcoming of the Poisson distribution is that the mean is equal to the variance, and thus one might use quasi-Poisson or a negative binomial instead. Another shortcoming is that insurance claims are usally zero inflated and thus a zero-inflated poisson model or a hurdle poisson model might be used instead.
